title: Bluelock Projects 30 Percent Revenue Increase, Delivers Exceptional Customer Satisfaction Score, Lays Foundation for Focused Growth
text:
Bluelock Projects 30 Percent Revenue Increase, Delivers Exceptional Customer Satisfaction Score, Lays Foundation for Focused Growth Bluelock grows its Disaster Recovery-as-a-Service market share with 150 percent monthly recurring revenue growth year-to-date October 13, 2015 09:30 AM Eastern Daylight Time 
INDIANAPOLIS--( BUSINESS WIRE )--Bluelock, provider of Disaster-Recovery-as-a-Service (DRaaS) for complex environments and sensitive data, today announces projected, overall revenue growth to increase by 30 percent by the end of the year. In addition, Bluelock dominates the DRaaS industry with a Net Promoter Score of 81 (a score of 50 is considered world-class), and achieves DRaaS monthly recurring revenue (MRR) growth of 150 percent year-to-date. Gartner 1 also recognizes Bluelock as a "Visionary" in the Magic Quadrant for Disaster Recovery as a Service. 
The DRaaS industry has seen rapid evolution and growth since 2012. According to Gartner , the estimated “size of the DRaaS market will be approximately $1.3 billion, with a related compound annual growth rate of approximately 30 percent.” By 2018, Gartner estimates that the size of the DRaaS market will exceed that of the market for more traditional subscription-based DR services. 
“Most companies are finding that disaster recovery is an ideal place to start the transition to cloud-based IT,” said Christopher Clapp, CEO, Bluelock. “In 2013, Bluelock launched its DRaaS service by leveraging its past success in delivering highly resilient cloud services. Over the past year, it’s become evident we have a unique ability to solve for complex disaster recovery requirements that other providers cannot or will not do, so we’re increasing our focus and investment in DRaaS.” 
Bluelock Recovery Assurance™ is a key driver for the success Bluelock has experienced in DRaaS. This program incorporates deliberate processes and services designed to ensure clients are completely confident their disaster recovery plan will work when needed. The Recovery Assurance processes are what enable Bluelock to successfully recover mission critical applications, secure complex environments that require high security or compliance and architect for hybrid configurations and large deployments. 
"We were looking for a partner in our DR strategy and have found that with Bluelock,” said David Walker, vice president of IT, Walker Information. “Their ability to handle complex environments and multiple tiers of recovery exceeded our expectations and, their Recovery Assurance program has given us confidence that we will be able to recover when needed." 
In 2015, Bluelock launched tailored disaster recovery solutions for sensitive data and HIPAA/HITECH. With an emphasis on providing full IT infrastructure resiliency to its clients, Bluelock continues to offer managed cloud hosting, both private and public options, with security and compliance as focus areas. Bluelock DRaaS and managed cloud hosting solutions support compliance frameworks such as HIPAA/HITECH, PCI, SOX and FERPA and its services and support follow ITIL-aligned processes, methods and procedures. 
To learn more about Bluelock’s DRaaS offerings visit, http://www.bluelock.com/cloud-recovery/ . 
About Bluelock 
Bluelock provides Disaster Recovery-as-a-Service for complex environments and sensitive data to help companies mitigate risk with confidence. Bluelock is the provider enterprise organizations turn to for highly resilient cloud services because of its ability to support unique requirements. Its exclusive program, Bluelock Recovery Assurance™ gives clients complete confidence their disaster recovery solution will be uncompromisingly secure, expertly tailored, thoroughly supported and comprehensively tested. With datacenters in the US, Bluelock supports a wide range of compliance frameworks and is SSAE 16 Type II SOC 2 audited.
